title: Timothy Gilbert
text:
(Ecologist ¬∑ Data Scientist ¬∑ Conservation Technologist)
If you‚Äôve made it here, that means you are interested in my work!
Welcome to my portfolio! I build intuitive data tools that translate ecological and clinical datasets into clear, actionable insights. My work blends R Shiny dashboards, SQL-backed applications, and data visualizations that support decision-making in conservation and health science domains.

title: Timothy Gilbert

Predictive Aquatic Chemistry Dashboard
Rangeland Visualization Tool

title: About
text:
Hi ‚Äî I‚Äôm Timothy, an ecologist turned data scientist with a passion for building tools that drive conservation, clinical progress, and environmental understanding. My journey began with wildlife fieldwork and trapping grid maps and has evolved into designing clean database schemas, predictive dashboards, and QA systems that empower teams to make data-backed decisions.
I thrive at the intersection of meaningful missions and technical complexity. Whether it‚Äôs wrangling messy ecological field data, designing visual workflows for conservation agencies, or exploring clinical programming standards like CDISC, I‚Äôm all in. I‚Äôve worked with federal agencies, research institutions, and cross-functional technical teams ‚Äî always aiming to improve clarity, utility, and insight.
I believe good data tools should be intuitive, adaptable, and human-centered. And I love the creative challenge of bridging field knowledge with analytical design. Most recently, I‚Äôve been exploring PK/PD modeling, clinical data transformation, and Quarto-based documentation systems to support scientific transparency and reproducibility.
